name: A Tale of Two Epidemics: Influenza 1918 and Covid 19
base_name: A Tale of Two Epidemics: Influenza 1918 and Covid 19
long_desc: This course will compare the experiences of Americans during its two deadliest pandemics, the Influenza 1918 epidemic and the Covid19 epidemic. Each week we will compare a facet of the two epidemics, such as government responses, medical knowledge, public health measures, African American experiences, global dimensions, and more. Students will do guided original research comparing a facet of the two epidemics.

custom_fields.goals: Students will increase their knowledge of epidemics in history, enhance their research skills, and selfpublish a book of student research.
custom_fields.key_topics: This course will compare the experiences of Americans during its two deadliest pandemics, the Influenza 1918 epidemic and the Covid-19 epidemic.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: The course will have readings, discussion, essays, a research project and paper, and oral presentations.
custom_fields.relevance: The course will help students understand their experience of the Covid-19 epidemic by putting it in a historical context.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Course materials will be available on line through Canvas, the CMU library, and other web sites.
